com.communote.server.api.core.note.processor

Interface NoteContentRenderingPreProcessor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Orderable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AliasAndTagLinkRenderer, CreateRepostNoteContentRenderingPreProcessor, SmileysNoteRenderingPreProcessor, TemplateNoteRenderingPreProcessor

    public interface NoteContentRenderingPreProcessor
extends Orderable
    This pre-processor is called before a note is rendered and thus provides a flexible way for making additional modifications to the content of a note.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_ORDER
      default order value

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      boolean isCachable()

      Processes the note content for a specific render context.

      Denotes whether the pre-processor replaces the note content completely.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ORDER

        static final int DEFAULT_ORDER
        default order value
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getOrder

        int getOrder()
        Specified by:
        getOrder in interface Orderable
        Returns:
        the order value which is interpreted as the priority of the pre-processor. The higher the priority, the earlier this processor will be called.

      • isCachable

        boolean isCachable()
        Returns:
        whether the result can be cached. This method has to return false if this PreProcessor modifies the content in a way that depends on other NoteRenderContext attributes than the NoteRenderMode (e.g. locale, request attributes or modeOptions). This PreProcessor should not modify the note metadata (NoteData object) while processing the content if this method returns true because the PreProcessor will not be invoked if the processed content was cached.

      • processNoteContent

        boolean processNoteContent(NoteRenderContext context,
                           NoteData item)
                    throws NoteRenderingPreProcessorException
        Processes the note content for a specific render context. This method will only be called if the processor supports the mode given by the render context.
        Parameters:
        context - holds details about the render context to allow specific processing in different situations
        item - the note item to process
        Returns:
        true if the item was modified, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NoteRenderingPreProcessorException - in case something unexpected lead to the failure of the processor

      • replacesContent

        boolean replacesContent()
        Denotes whether the pre-processor replaces the note content completely.
        Returns:
        true if the processor replaces the content and the shortened content completely. If the processor only modifies parts of the content or other members of the item, false should be returned. When replacing content the new content must match the render mode.

      • supports

        boolean supports(NoteRenderMode mode,
                 NoteData note)
        Whether the processor supports a specific render mode. When returning true and the processor modifies or replaces the note content it must ensure that it only inserts text which matches the render mode, specifically the processor shouldn't insert HTML markup when called in PLAIN mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the note render mode, never null
        note - the note to render. A pre-processor can use this parameter to decide based on note attributes whether the note content should be processed
        Returns:
        true if the mode can be handled by the processor, false otherwise
